item.title: Best Air Purifying Plants
item.description: We love any excuse to buy more plants, and you may have heard they can improve your home‚Äôs indoor air quality. But before you blow your paycheck in the name of a healthier home, let‚Äôs dive deeper into plants‚Äô air purifying powers. We‚Äôll share which plants we recommend and what benefits you can actually expect from them. We‚Äôve heard for years about how plants act as natural air filters for your home. So let‚Äôs dive a little deeper, shall we? 7 Air Purifying Plants If you just came here for a list, our favorite air purifying houseplants are bulleted below. The best part is these are all beautiful, low-maintenance plants. Many also appear on our best low-light indoor plants list too! Dracaena (including Corn Plant ) Snake Plant Aglaonema English Ivy Pothos Bamboo Palm Spider Plant There are certainly more that could be included here, but we narrowed it to the ones that are most often cited by experts AND the plants that we think look best too. Continue reading Best Air Purifying Plants at Young House Love.

item.title: A Weekend In New Orleans With Kids
item.description: Since our travel guides to Charleston with kids and Palm Springs with kids have elicited requests for more travel ideas with kids, we‚Äôre back with an overdue recap of our 3-night trip to New Orleans. We‚Äôd never been to The Big Easy before and were impressed by how family-friendly the city is. It‚Äôs not all booze, beads, and Bourbon Street! So here‚Äôs a look at where we stayed, what we did, and what we‚Äôre excited to do next time we go back ‚Äì because we will definitely go back! The four of us (well, five if you count our chihuahua!) went to NOLA for 3 nights in November of 2022. At the time, our kids were 8 and 12 years old. So unfortunately we can‚Äôt vouch for our suggestions being a good fit for toddlers or younger children. Although I‚Äôm sure ours would‚Äôve loved the Louisiana Children‚Äôs Museum and Storyland playground back in the day! Continue reading A Weekend In New Orleans With Kids at Young House Love.

item.title: 9 Easy Low-Light Indoor Plants
item.description: I used to think every houseplant needed a sunny corner or bright windowsill to thrive. But it turns out many of our favorite go-to houseplants do just fine in shady corners and low-light locations. So before you write off your house as too dark to sustain plant life, check out this list of the best indoor plants for low light. You might be surprised at how many good options there are! Our upstairs family room is the brightest room we‚Äôve ever owned thanks to big unobstructed windows on all 4 sides. But most of our indoor plants live downstairs, where we get far less natural light. Luckily, that hasn‚Äôt stopped us from growing our collection of happy healthy houseplants. 9 Houseplants That Don‚Äôt Need A Lot Of Light Here are our favorite low-light indoor plants. We list a lot more info on them below, but here‚Äôs a quick list to bring on your next trip to the plant store: Snake Plant ZZ Plant Pothos Heartleaf Philodendron English Ivy Aglaonema Cast Iron Plant Monstera Parlor Palm Perhaps our favorite part of this list is that these aren‚Äôt ugly ‚Äúconsolation plants‚Äù that people begrudgingly buy for dark homes. Continue reading 9 Easy Low-Light Indoor Plants at Young House Love.

item.title: How To Remove Wallpaper: 4 Proven Methods
item.description: Wallpaper has made a big comeback as a trendy home design choice. But despite its resurgence, there are still plenty of us dealing with dingy, dated, or downright ugly old wallpaper we don‚Äôt want. In our old home, we had to remove wallpaper in so many rooms: the kitchen, the dining room, the foyer, and two different bathrooms! As we traveled from room to room removing wallpaper, we tested 4 different methods, and today we‚Äôll share what we learned. Removing wallpaper doesn‚Äôt require special tools or lots of money. It‚Äôs a totally doable project for any homeowner. However, it can be a tedious process that can take elbow grease and patience, depending on the size of your room and the stubbornness of your wallpaper. But having removed several rooms worth of decades-old wallpaper, we can confidently say it‚Äôs worth the effort! You can also check out more before and afters of our once-wallpapered rooms. Continue reading How To Remove Wallpaper: 4 Proven Methods at Young House Love.

item.title: Aglaonema Plant ‚Äì Complete Care Guide
item.description: Aglaonema, also called the Chinese Evergreen Plant, is an easy-care houseplant that lives happily in many lighting conditions ‚Äì even a dark corner of our daughter‚Äôs room. There are dozens of different Aglaonema varieties, most with large tropical foliage and colors ranging from silvery-green, red, and even vibrant pink. They‚Äôre also tough to kill, so they‚Äôre a great option for forgetful plant owners or anyone looking for an easy win in the plant department. These truly have been very low maintenance for us. We purchased our two Aglaonemas (pronounced ag-lee-oh-neem-ah ) to put atop our daughter‚Äôs closet. It‚Äôs sometimes hard to distinguish different varieties, but we believe that‚Äôs an Aglaonema Silver (right) and either a Candy Cane or Princess Silver Queen (left). Aglaonema Quick Facts Here‚Äôs what you need to know about your Aglaonema at a glance: Latin name : Aglaonema is the genus under which there are 21 recognized species . Continue reading Aglaonema Plant ‚Äì Complete Care Guide at Young House Love.
